info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 1:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 145 PM MDT... At 115 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lincoln, or 21 miles northeast of Ruidoso, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Hondo, Arabela, Glencoe, Lincoln State Monument, and San Patricio. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 93 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
